title: USA TODAY Releases First AR Interactive of 2019 with the Washington Capitals Player
text:
CLOSE

USA TODAY NETWORK, who has been experimenting in emerging technologies such as virtual reality and augmented reality since 2015, released its first AR piece of 2019.

This year, USA TODAY NETWORK is pioneering the landscape of AR by incorporating full animation and interactivity into its capabilities to create more compelling content experiences, beginning with sports content.

For its first piece of 2019, the award-winning emerging technology team created an AR interactive rendering of the Washington Capitals defenseman, John Carlson. The experience includes three 3D models of Carlson, each with an audio narration of him discussing the upcoming All Star game, his journey to the Stanley Cup, and his position as a Capitals defenseman.

USA TODAY NETWORK’s emerging tech team developed the AR interactive in one week, showcasing its ability to produce interactive content with efficiency and at scale. “This is going to be a very exciting year for our team and our audience,” said Ray Soto, Director of Emerging Technology. “We have set an ambitious goal for the number of interactive experiences to produce this year and across different content verticals, and look forward to bringing our audiences more immersive and interactive stories throughout the year.”

You can experience the AR piece in the USA TODAY app on Android and iOS devices within the Sports section.
